1.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme

2.brief: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

3.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
ten; by abbreviated form ten strings, and so a decachord
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a murmuring sound, i.e. a musical notation (probably similar to the modern affettuoso to indicate solemnity of movement); by implication, a machination

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)

5.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
to be (causatively, make) deep (literally or figuratively)
a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice)

6.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, foot (as consumed); i.e. (by exten.) of cattle brutishness; (concretely) stupid
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

7.brief: to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to twinkle, i.e. glance; by analogy, to blossom (figuratively, flourish)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

8.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

9.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

10.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power
to overflow (specifically with oil.); by implication, to mix; to fodder
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
verdant; by analogy, new; figuratively, prosperous

11.brief: to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

12.brief: to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish
a cedar tree (from the tenacity of its roots)
Lebanon, a mountain range in Palestine

13.brief: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish

14.brief: properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to germinate, i.e. (figuratively) to (causatively, make) flourish; also (of words), to utter
verdant; by analogy, new; figuratively, prosperous
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

15.brief: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
